definition: see 天荒地老[tian1 huang1 di4 lao3]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
day/sky/heaven
desolate/shortage/scarce/out of practice/absurd/uncultivated/to neglect

sentences.english: Just to sing the autumn season Sad Song, jealously guarding one's the end of time?
sentences.chinese: 只爲了吟唱一季悽婉的秋歌，獨守一個人的地老天荒？

sentences.english: I will be your Valentine until the end of time.
sentences.chinese: 地老天荒，我將是你的情人。

sentences.english: Years cardamom, who made who The end of life.
sentences.chinese: 彼年豆蔻，誰許誰地老天荒。

sentences.english: R & B's thoughts, so that memory Tuicheng white.
sentences.chinese: 地老天荒的思念，使記憶褪成白色。

sentences.english: Really want to take your hug in the bosom, and so on, until the end of time.
sentences.chinese: 真的想把你摟在懷裏，如此下去，直到地老天荒。

sentences.english: I took for granted, all the times, qqgxqm that I thought would last somehow.
sentences.chinese: 我一直認爲，你我會愛到地老天荒。

sentences.english: Originally, I still not our the end of life.
sentences.chinese: 原來，我還是來不及我們的地老天荒。

sentences.english: This is just my personal R &B.
sentences.chinese: 這也不過是我一個人的地老天荒。

sentences.english: Love can touch us one time and last for a lifetime. And never let go till we're gone.
sentences.chinese: 一次愛的感動，延綿一生，永不言棄，直至地老天荒。

sentences.english: Want to love not to stop to the end of life, need much courage.
sentences.chinese: 想要戀愛不斷站開往地老天荒，須要多英勇。

sentences.english: I wish I could believe there was somebody who would love me for ever.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我可以相信有人會愛我到地老天荒。

definition: until the end of time (idiom)
lit. when the seas run dry and the stones go soft (idiom)/fig. forever/until the end of time
enduring while the world lasts (idiom)/eternal
a whole lifetime (idiom); all my life
see 天涯海角[tian1 ya2 hai3 jiao3]
from dawn to dusk/all the time
hoary head/old age
enduring while the world lasts (idiom, from Laozi); eternal/for ever and ever (of friendship, hate etc)/also written 天長地久|天长地久
in love and inseparable
to stay together/to rely on one another
to pledge undying love (idiom); oath of eternal love/to swear by all the Gods
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
to moisten with spittle (idiom); sharing meager resources/mutual help in humble circumstances
Cape Haijiao in Sanya 三亞|三亚[San1 ya4], Hainan
the ends of the earth/separated worlds apart
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
ten thousand crags and torrents (idiom); the trials and tribulations of a long journey/a long and difficult road
